title: Sichuan Hot and Sour Potatoes
source: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
categories: A Very Chinese Cookbook - Kevin Pang
ingredients: - 1 pound large yellow waxy potatoes, peeled
- 1 Thai chile, stemmed and sliced thin
directions: 1. Slice potatoes into 1/8-inch planks, then cut planks into 1/8-inch matchsticks. Transfer potatoes to a bowl and submerge in cold water. Soak for 10 minutes, then drain in a colander. Transfer to a paper towel–lined plate and set aside.

2. Heat oil and peppercorns in a 14-inch flat-bottomed wok over medium heat, stirring constantly, until peppercorns are sizzling and fragrant but not darkened, about 2 minutes. Using a slotted spoon, remove peppercorns and discard, reserving the oil.
3. Add Thai chile to oil in wok and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, about 15 seconds.
4. Increase heat to high, add potatoes, and cook, tossing slowly but constantly, until potatoes are crisp-tender, about 2 minutes.
5. Add scallions, salt, and sugar and toss to combine.
6. Off heat, add vinegar and toss to combine. Serve warm or at room temperature.
